ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies how to handle new and existing fonts in the SAS registry.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Add fonts that do not already exist in the SAS registry. Do not modify existing fonts.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Add new fonts that do not already exist in the SAS registry and replace fonts that already  exist in the SAS registry.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Replace fonts that already exist in the SAS registry. Do not add new fonts.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the level of detail to include in the SAS log.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: SAS log messages include which fonts were added, which fonts were not added, and which  fonts were not understood, as well as a summary that indicates the number of fonts  that were added, not added, and not understood.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: SAS log messages include which fonts were added, and a summary that indicates the number  of fonts that were added, not added, and not understood.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: SAS log messages include only the summary that indicates the number of fonts that were  added, not added, and not understood.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: No messages are written to the SAS log, except for errors (if encountered).

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the procedure should run without actually updating the SAS registry. 
This option enables you to test the procedure on the specified fonts before 
modifying the SAS registry.
Specifies that the SAS registry in the SASHELP library should be updated.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FONTFILE 'file' <...'file'> || 'file-1, pfm-file-1, afm-file-1' <...'file-n'>;
      
Specifies one or more font files to be processed.

Syntax: FONTPATH 'directory' <...'directory'>;
      
Specifies one or more directories to be searched for valid font files to process.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that all font families in the Core\Printing\Freetype\Fonts key in the 
SAS registry will be deleted.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TRUETYPE 'directory' <...'directory'>;
      
Specifies one or more directories to be searched for TrueType font files.

Syntax: TYPE1 'directory' <...'directory'>;
      
Specifies one or more directories to be searched for valid Type1 font files.

Syntax: OPENTYPE <fileref> 'directory' <…'directory'>;
      
Specifies one or more directories to be searched for valid OpenType font files. 

Required Argument:
directory
  specifies a directory to search. Only files that are recognized as valid OpenType font files 
  are processed. Each directory must be enclosed in quotation marks. If you specify more than one 
  directory, then you must separate the directories with a space.
  
Optional Argument:
fileref
  specifies a fileref to use with the OPENTYPE statement.
